text:
="preserve">Leif Anthony Mills (25 March 1936 – 17 December 2020) was a British trade unionist and politician. He was General-Secretary of the Banking, Insurance and Finance Union from 1972 to 1996. In 1995, he was President of the Trades Union Congress.
He unsuccessfully ran for the Labour Party in Salisbury at the 1964 general election.
Mills died on 17 December 2020 from vascular dementia at the age of 84.

annotations.surface_form: President of the Trades Union Congress
